Criteria of artistic film making. Examples from motion pictures are screened and discussed.

Name: Theater Participation 2.
prereq: 3 s.h. of THTR 2600 or permission of the instructor.
description: Theater Participation 2. Advanced involvement in the main stage productions of the department. Students will audition for all main stage productions, or accept a significant assignment in stage management, costume, scenery, lighting or other technical element of production. Must be taken each semester during the time that a student is in junior/senior residence as a theater major, for a minimum of 4 or its equivalent.

Name: Stage Makeup.
description: Stage Makeup. Design and application of makeup for the stage including techniques for character and age makeup, making and applying facial hair, and other specialized makeup procedures.

Name: Directing 1.
prereq: THTR 1559 and THTR 3768 or concurrently or permission of instructor.
description: Directing 1. An intensive study of the process of directing plays. Whenever possible, students direct the equivalent of a one-act play for public presentation. Lab hours by arrangement.

Name: Scene Design.
prereq: THTR 1559 and 1561 or consent of the instructor.
description: Scene Design. The history of design in terms of stage scenery; an investigation of current trends, techniques, and media; practical execution of models and sketches by the student.

Name: History of Stage Costume.
description: History of Stage Costume. A survey of stage costumes based on western styles from the ancient Egyptians to the present with emphasis on periods in which the theater flourished.

Name: Lighting Design.
prereq: THTR 1559 and 1561 or consent of instructor.
description: Lighting Design. A study of historical development, basic electrical theory, switch boards and lighting instruments; color theory, principles and practices in stage lighting. Lab hours to be arranged.

Name: Stage Combat.
prereq: THTR 2668 or MUEN 0012 or HPES 1514 or permission of instructor.
description: Stage Combat. Applied skills class specializing in armed and unarmed combat for the stage. Safety factors in stage fighting, including safe use of rapier and dagger. Performance in public required.

Name: Script Analysis.
description: Script Analysis. Critical approaches to dramatic literature. Analysis of dramatic works for production values.

Name: Costume Design.
description: Costume Design. Costume design for the stage through a study of script analysis, design concepts and principles, and costume rendering techniques.

Name: Rehearsal and Performance.
prereq: THTR 2668 or DNCE 1542 and faculty approval.
description: Rehearsal and Performance. Faculty-supervised study and practical demonstration of a theater or dance performance. Credit given for significant acting or dancing roles, assistant directing, or stage management assignments in Department of Theater and Dance programming. For students with appropriate experience. May be taken twice.

Name: Projects in Production.
prereq: THTR 3763 or 3765 or 3769 and theater faculty committee approval.
description: Projects in Production. Faculty-supervised study resulting in the design and/or execution of scenery, lighting, or costumes for public performance. For students with appropriate experience. May be taken twice.

Name: Theater History after 1700.
prereq: 9 s.h. of THTR coursework, 3 of which must be upper division.
description: Theater History after 1700. History of the physical theater and representative dramatic texts from 1700 to the modern era.

Name: Acting 3: Styles.
description: Acting 3: Styles. A study of specific theories, techniques, and approaches to creating the various styles of acting. Emphasis on scene study featuring important historical styles of performance.

Name: Summer Theater Workshop.
prereq: Junior standing in Theater, or permission of instructor.
description: Summer Theater Workshop. Participation in the summer theater program involving all aspects of theatrical production. Positions of significant responsibility.

Name: Children’s Theater.
prereq: THTR 3762 or senior standing in Elementary Education with permission of instructor.
description: Children’s Theater. A study of the process of theater production by and for elementary school children, including theory, objectives, and methods.

Name: Creative Dramatics.
prereq: Junior standing with 9 s.h. of theater courses (including 1559 and 2668) or junior standing in Elementary Education with permission of instructor.
description: Creative Dramatics. Basic elements of playmaking, improvisation, story dramatization, pantomime, dialogue, and characterization. Experience with area school children provided when possible. Intended for elementary education majors and drama certification.

Name: Acting 4: Acting on Camera.
prereq: THTR 2668 and 2667 and junior standing, or consent of instructor.
description: Acting 4: Acting on Camera. A exploration of the theory and technique of film and video performance, and the special demands they make upon an actor.

Name: Theater History Before 1700.
prereq: 9 s.h. of THTR coursework, 3 of which must be upper division.
description: Theater History Before 1700. History of the physical theater and representative dramatic texts from the Classical period through the Renaissance.

Name: Independent Study in Theater.
description: Independent Study in Theater. Independent work in theater production under faculty/staff guidance. Intended as a continuation of individualized creative work beyond THTR 3791 or THTR 3792. Project dependent upon approval of the evaluating faculty member and the student. May be repeated with different topics for a total of 9 s.h.

Name: Arts in Education Internship: Theater.
description: Arts in Education Internship: Theater. A practical application of drama/theater in education theories and skills in a field-based lab experience in the schools. Students submit project proposals geared either to the elementary or secondary level. Proposals must be approved by a theater faculty committee. Repeatable for a total of 6 s.h.

Name: Senior Project.
prereq: Senior standing with the expectation of graduating by the end of the following semester. Grading is A,B,C,NC/PR.
description: Senior Project. Capstone experience expected of all seniors in the degree programs of the department. Significant demonstration of practical or scholarly ability in one of the sub-disciplines comprising the disciplines of theater or dance, and showing evidence of solid writing, speaking, and critical thinking skills.

Name: Topics in Theater.
prereq: Junior standing or permission of instructor.
description: Topics in Theater. In-depth study of selected aspects in theater scholarship, theory or practice. May be repeated if the topic changes.

Name: Directing 2.
description: Directing 2. A study of specific theories, techniques, and various important styles in play directing.

Name: Introduction to Women’s Studies.
description: Introduction to Women’s Studies. Introduces key concepts, theoretical frameworks, and interdisciplinary research drawn from current scholarship about women. Concentrates on major issues relevant to the status and roles of contemporary women, including examination of effects of sexism, racism, ethnicity, and class distinction.

Name: Special Topics in Women's Studies.
description: Special Topics in Women's Studies. May be repeated for a maximum of 6 s.h. with different topics.

Name: Senior Research Project.
prereq: Senior standing, completion of 15 s.h. in Women’s Studies, and permission of program director. Grading is Traditional/PR.
description: Senior Research Project. Research and writing of a paper on a topic in women’s studies, under the supervision of full-time faculty.
